Experiments

Experiment Log

This page contains the experiment log for our development of the application throughout term 1. The experiment is a souped-up to-do list that demonstrates good and bad outcomes of the experiments and research we have done.

No Title Details Results Outcome Done by Date
1 Formalise requirements In order to get requirements of the app we arranged skype meetings with our client to discuss them and summarised the requirements which were approved by the client Completed MoSCoW Requirements Success Matt Bell 14th OCT
2 Experiment on matching algorithms We researched and experimented on algorithms such as the Stable Marriage problem and Gale Shapley Algorithm by using manual test cases for different sets of data. We applied the algorithm on data sets with even number of mentor and mentees and also different number of mentors and mentees. Successfully designed a working algorithm that solves the problem outlined by our client and also constructed pseuodocode for future development Success Christopher,Matt Bell 30th OCT
3 UI design research Experiment on different UI designs by producing different sketches and evaluating the best designs Made a initial sketch with several pages that shows how users could register for a program. Success Harry Chen 6th NOV
4 Use cases Experiment on different use cases that shows what users could do and how they achieve their goals We managed to complete 8 use cases which covered basic features such as registration, application of mentorship programs etc Success Harry Chen, Christopher 9th NOV
5 Explore existing solutions We explored various existing solutions online for any current application that fit our requirements and experimented on some features of these applications by trying them out. Found two existing solutions: Mentor match and Business mentoring, also noticed that dating apps had somewhat similar features. Success Harry Chen, Christopher 11th NOV
6 Explore different tech stacks Since we are going to make a web app, we looked into various front-end and back-end frameworks. Some of us also experimented on using these frameworks during our scenario week. Our research covered lots of frameworks for both front-end side and back-end side, like NodeJS, Django,AngularJS, we compared them and decided to use AngularJS and Django to develop our app. Success Christpher, Matt Bell, Harry Chen 20th NOV
7 First prototype Create a prototype to showcase the main functionalities that we are going to implement in our final application. We also performed many run-throughs on the overall flow of the prototype. We used Ionic creator and created a interactive prototype based on our initial UI sketch and MoSCoW requirements Success Harry Chen 2nd DEC

ATOS Mentor Matching App

Matthew Bell, Christopher Lau, Harry Chen
